title: (x) Ultravox "Lament" album cover - Bembo, Gill Sans {Geoff, Isaac}
content:
Hi, coule anyone help with naming these typefaces?  
Thanks in adavnce.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007190837im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ultravox_-_lament_a_4013.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Looking for Latin equivalent to Cyrillic book cover type - various {gang}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007190837/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20434 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Black slab "Ghetto Luxury" - Princeton (filled) {Richard M} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007190837/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20385 "Go to next forum topic")
author: apparatus™

comments.content:
Bembo, the tail of t looks like it’s been sliced off, is this pre-digital?

The U is probably your standard issue Helvetica or Univers.
It looks Garamondish—not Adobe Garamond—except the U, which I’ll just take a stab at and say Gill Sans. I’m still looking for a match. I have a feeling I should check in standard system fonts.
Yeah, well… there you go. What took you so long Geoff?

I just had to double check! :^)

You might be right about Gill Sans for the U, it’s a bit short for Helvetica.

Great! Thanks Geoff and Isaac.  
Yeah I think it is pre-digital Bembo.  
Geoff, you are right about the t is slightly different.  
Do you know who produced the closest digital version to the original?  
Who is a renowned foundry who produces type strict to originals?  
Thanks!

I just had a look at metal Bembo and it doesn’t have this odd t which seems to imply the designer of this cover altered the forms.

\> Do you know who produced the closest digital version to the original?  
\> Who is a renowned foundry who produces type strict to originals?

That would be Monotype, they recently released a digital version called [Bembo Book](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007190837/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/bembo-book/), it looks quite good for text but I haven’t used nor seen how it looks on paper.
